title: 2 Ways to Change to Landscape in Word: Page & Entire Document

steps.title: Open the document in Microsoft Word.
steps.content: Open the document in Microsoft Word. You can do this by double-clicking the document on your computer. Alternatively, open Microsoft Word first (under All Apps in the Start menu on Windows, or in the Applications folder on macOS), then open the document.

steps.title: Click the Layout or Page Layout menu.
steps.content: Click the Layout or Page Layout menu. It’s at the top of the screen. The name will vary depending on your version of Word. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Orientation menu.
steps.content: Click the Orientation menu. A drop-down menu will appear. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click Landscape.
steps.content: Click Landscape . The entire document is now in landscape mode. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Open the document in Microsoft Word.
steps.content: Open the document in Microsoft Word. You can do this by double-clicking the document on your computer. Alternatively, open Microsoft Word first (under All Apps in the Start menu on Windows, or in the Applications folder on macOS), then open the document.

steps.title: Click the cursor at the beginning of the page you want to rotate.
steps.content: Click the cursor at the beginning of the page you want to rotate. Clicking right before the first character on the page should do the trick.

steps.title: Click Layout or Page Layout.
steps.content: Click Layout or Page Layout . It’s one of the menus at the top of Word. The name you see will vary depending on your version. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Breaks menu.
steps.content: Click the Breaks menu. A list of various types of breaks will appear. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click Next Page.
steps.content: Click Next Page . It’s under the “Section Breaks” header. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Layout or Page Layout again.
steps.content: Click the Layout or Page Layout again.

steps.title: Click the Orientation menu.
steps.content: Click the Orientation menu. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Click Landscape.
steps.content: Click Landscape . This page (and any that follow it) is now in landscape mode. Since you only want to rotate one page, you’ll just need to add another break at the bottom of the page to convert the remaining pages back to portrait mode.

steps.title: Click the cursor at the beginning of the next page.
steps.content: Click the cursor at the beginning of the next page.

steps.title: Click Next Page.
steps.content: Click Next Page . [9] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Orientation menu.
steps.content: Click the Orientation menu. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Click Portrait.
steps.content: Click Portrait . The remaining pages after this break will all be in portrait mode, while the page(s) between the breaks will remain in landscape.
